links.title: List Certificate Packs
links.description: For a given zone, list all active certificate packs

status.description: Include Certificate Packs of all statuses, not just active ones.

links.title: Get Certificate Pack
links.description: For a given zone, get a certificate pack

links.title: Get Certificate Pack Quotas
links.description: For a given zone, list certificate pack quotas

links.title: Order Certificate Pack
links.description: For a given zone, order a certificate pack with a list of hostnames

hosts.description: Comma separated list of valid host names for the certificate packs. Must contain the zone apex, may not contain more than 50 hosts, and may not be empty.

links.title: Order Advanced Certificate Manager Certificate Pack
links.description: For a given zone, order an advanced certificate pack

hosts.description: Comma separated list of valid host names for the certificate packs. Must contain the zone apex, may not contain more than 50 hosts, and may not be empty.

validation_method.description: Validation Method selected for the order

validity_days.description: Validity Days selected for the order

certificate_authority.description: Certificate Authority selected for the order.  Selecting Let's Encrypt will reduce customization of other fields: validation_method must be 'txt', validity_days must be 90, cloudflare_branding must be omitted, and hosts must contain only 2 entries, one for the zone name and one for the subdomain wildcard of the zone name (e.g. example.com, *.example.com).

cloudflare_branding.description: Whether or not to add Cloudflare Branding for the order.  This will add sni.cloudflaressl.com as the Common Name if set true

links.title: Restart Validation for Advanced Certificate Manager Certificate Pack
links.description: For a given zone, restart validation for an advanced certificate pack.  This is only a validation operation for a Certificate Pack in a validation_timed_out status.

links.title: Delete Advanced Certificate Manager Certificate Pack
links.description: For a given zone, delete an advanced certificate pack

cfLinkErrors.1401: Error while requesting from certificate service
cfLinkErrors.1402: Error while requesting from certificate service
cfLinkErrors.1405: Missing required certificate pack id for deletion
cfLinkErrors.1408: ID is not a dedicated or advanced certificate.
cfLinkErrors.1409: Error while requesting from certificate service
cfLinkErrors.1411: ID is not a dedicated or advanced certificate.
cfLinkErrors.1413: You do not have sufficient entitlements to order the Dedicated Certificate. If you recently deleted a Dedicated Certificate it may still be pending removal. Please try again and contact your Customer Success Manager or Cloudflare Support for assistance if the issue persists.
cfLinkErrors.1414: You must complete domain control validation (DCV) for all hostnames on the Dedicated Certificate before placing an order.

id.description: The unique identifier for a certificate_pack

hosts.description: Comma separated list of valid host names for the certificate packs. Must contain the zone apex, may not contain more than 50 hosts, and may not be empty.

items.title: Custom SSL for a Zone
items.description: Custom SSL certificate for a zone
The valid hosts for the certificates

issuer.description: The certificate authority that issued the certificate

status.description: Status of the zone's custom SSL

priority.description: The order/priority in which the certificate will be used in a request. The higher priority will break ties across overlapping 'legacy_custom' certificates, but 'legacy_custom' certificates will always supercede 'sni_custom' certificates.

signature.description: The type of hash used for the certificate

expires_on.description: When the certificate from the authority expires

uploaded_on.description: When the certificate was uploaded to Cloudflare

modified_on.description: When the certificate was last modified

certificate.description: The zone's SSL certificate or certificate and the intermediate(s)

bundle_method.description: A ubiquitous bundle has the highest probability of being verified everywhere, even by clients using outdated or unusual trust stores. An optimal bundle uses the shortest chain and newest intermediates. And the force bundle verifies the chain, but does not otherwise modify it.

geo_restrictions.description: Specify the region where your private key can be held locally for optimal TLS performance. HTTPS connections to any excluded data center will still be fully encrypted, but will incur some latency while Keyless SSL is used to complete the handshake with the nearest allowed data center. Options allow distribution to only to U.S. data centers, only to E.U. data centers, or only to highest security data centers. Default distribution is to all Cloudflare datacenters, for optimal performance.

policy.description: Specify the policy that determines the region where your private key will be held locally. HTTPS connections to any excluded data center will still be fully encrypted, but will incur some latency while Keyless SSL is used to complete the handshake with the nearest allowed data center. Any combination of countries, specified by their two letter country code (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2#Officially_assigned_code_elements) can be chosen, such as 'country: IN', as well as 'region: EU' which refers to the EU region. If there are too few data centers satisfying the policy, it will be rejected.

type.description: The type 'legacy_custom' enables support for legacy clients which do not include SNI in the TLS handshake.

HTTPS connections to any excluded data center will still be fully encrypted, but will incur some latency while Keyless SSL is used to complete the handshake with the nearest allowed data center. Options allow distribution to only to U.S. data centers, only to E.U. data centers, or only to highest security data centers. Any combination of countries, specified by their two letter country code (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2#Officially_assigned_code_elements) can be chosen, such as 'country: IN', as well as 'region: EU' which refers to the EU region. keyless_server.title: Keyless SSL for a Zone
keyless_server.description: A Keyless certificate is an SSL certificate where the SSL private key is not stored on Cloudflare

port.description: The keyless SSL port used to commmunicate between Cloudflare and the client's Keyless SSL server

enabled.description: Whether or not the Keyless SSL is on or off

permissions.description: Available permissions for the Keyless SSL for the current user requesting the item

created_on.description: When the Keyless SSL was created

modified_on.description: When the Keyless SSL was last modified

links.title: Edit SSL Configuration
links.description: Upload a new private key and/or PEM/CRT for the SSL certificate. Note: PATCHing a configuration for sni_custom certificates will result in a new resource id being returned, and the previous one being deleted.

An optimal bundle uses the shortest chain and newest intermediates. And the force bundle verifies the chain, but does not otherwise modify it.

geo_restrictions.description: Specify the region where your private key can be held locally for optimal TLS performance. HTTPS connections to any excluded data center will still be fully encrypted, but will incur some latency while Keyless SSL is used to complete the handshake with the nearest allowed data center. Options allow distribution to only to U.S. data centers, only to E.U. data centers, or only to highest security data centers. Default distribution is to all Cloudflare datacenters, for optimal performance.

policy.description: Specify the policy that determines the region where your private key will be held locally. HTTPS connections to any excluded data center will still be fully encrypted, but will incur some latency while Keyless SSL is used to complete the handshake with the nearest allowed data center. Any combination of countries, specified by their two letter country code (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2#Officially_assigned_code_elements) can be chosen, such as 'country: IN', as well as 'region: EU' which refers to the EU region. If there are too few data centers satisfying the policy, it will be rejected.

links.title: Re-prioritize SSL Certificates
links.description: If a zone has multiple SSL certificates, you can set the order in which they should be used during a request. The higher priority will break ties across overlapping 'legacy_custom' certificates.

priority.description: The order/priority in which the certificate will be used in a request. The higher priority will break ties across overlapping 'legacy_custom' certificates, but 'legacy_custom' certificates will always supercede 'sni_custom' certificates.
